Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Monthly personal allowance of BND$500
- Monthly meals allowance of BND$150
- Annual book allowance of BND$600
- On-campus accommodation
- Round-trip economy class airfare (to and from Brunei Darussalam)
Eligible_Applicants: The scholarship is open to international students (foreign students). Brunei Darussalam Permanent Residents are NOT eligible. Applicants must not exceed 25 years old at the time of application.
Eligible_Fields: Arts, Sciences, Engineering, Islamic Studies, Business, Humanities, Specific Education, Fine Arts
Special_Circumstances: PhD programmes are explicitly stated as not being offered under the BDGS scholarship. Scholarship recipients are not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country's representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the scholarship duration. Upon completion of the program, the scholarship recipient is required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect and return to their country of origin.
Other_Requirements: Two reference letters (C1 and C2) are required. Applicants applying to Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete a separate online application through UBD's admission portal. The application form must be duly completed and endorsed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs or the relevant agency responsible for the Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship in the applicant's home country.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship (BDGS) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered annually by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Brunei Darussalam. It provides international students with the opportunity to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master's Degree programs at leading higher education institutions in Brunei Darussalam. The scholarship is valid for the minimum period required to obtain the specific degree.
Application_Documents:
- Duly completed Application Form
- Reference Letter C1
- Reference Letter C2
- English language test scores (IELTS or TOEFL)
- High school diploma/equivalent (for Undergraduate applicants)
- Bachelor's degree certificate and transcripts (for Postgraduate Master's applicants)
Timeline:
January 26, 2025 : Application Opening Date
February 15, 2025 : Application Deadline
Late 2025 : Notification of Results

Scholarship_Name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
This is a fully funded scholarship, providing comprehensive financial support. It covers full tuition fees and includes a monthly stipend to assist with living expenses. The scholarship may also offer partial tuition waivers in some cases, alongside covering general living costs.
Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition fees
*   Monthly stipend for living expenses
*   Living Costs
*   Partial Tuition Waivers (where applicable)
Quantity: A very limited number of scholarships are offered each year. The exact number of awards is not specified by the university.
Eligible_Applicants: Open to international students from non-EU/EEA countries/citizens. Applicants must be highly qualified, demonstrate academic excellence, and possess a strong motivation to study. Successful admission to an eligible Master's degree program at the University of Southern Denmark is a prerequisite for scholarship consideration. No strict upper age limit for applicants.
Eligible_Fields: Master’s degree programs. Restricted to certain programs offered on the new campus in Vejle or specific Master’s degree programs at the Sønderborg campus. Example: MSc in Engineering – Mechatronics at the Sønderborg campus.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are required to submit reference letters (also known as letters of recommendation). A motivation letter or statement of purpose is a mandatory component of the application. Incomplete or late applications will not be eligible for the scholarship. One source states that "no IELTS is needed," which directly conflicts with the general requirement for English language proficiency. Applicants should confirm the specific English language test requirements (including IELTS acceptance and minimum scores) directly with the University of Southern Denmark for their chosen program.
Scholarship_Info: The SDU Danish Government Scholarship is a prestigious, merit-based opportunity designed to acknowledge the significant contributions of non-EU/EEA students. It offers a transformative chance for international students to pursue postgraduate education at the University of Southern Denmark, a globally recognized institution.
Application_Documents:
Academic transcripts and degree certificates (evidence of undergraduate degree)
Proof of English language proficiency
Statement of purpose or motivation letter
Curriculum Vitae (CV/resume)
Reference letters (letters of recommendation)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
This is a fully funded scholarship offering complete financial support to its recipients. The comprehensive coverage includes:

Eligible_Fields: No specific field restrictions are mentioned, implying availability across various faculties and departments at Chulalongkorn University.
Special_Circumstances: Recipients are not permitted to postpone the period of scholarship acceptance as proposed by Chulalongkorn University.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are expected to be 'excellent students.'
Scholarship_Info: The Chulalongkorn University Thai Government Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded opportunity for international students to pursue graduate (Master's and PhD) and, in some cases, undergraduate degrees at Chulalongkorn University in Thailand. Provided by the Thai Government, this scholarship aims to attract excellent students from ASEAN and Non-ASEAN countries, offering comprehensive financial support.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Monthly allowances are provided to cover living costs, varying by study level:
*   Undergraduate students: CNY 2,500 per month
*   Master's students/general scholars: CNY 3,000 per month
*   Doctoral students/senior scholars: CNY 3,500 per month

Covered Expenses (Full Scholarship):
*   Tuition at the Chinese institution
*   On-campus accommodation (or a subsidy for off-campus housing)
*   Comprehensive health insurance
*   Education costs
*   Administration costs
*   Expenditures to support student activities

Eligible_Applicants: Applicants must be citizens of a country other than the People's Republic of China, and be in good mental and physical health. They must not have completed their previous study within China, or at least one year must have passed since its completion. The scholarship is open to applicants of any gender. Specific programs have additional criteria: 'Silk Road' Program is for nationals of countries belonging to China's 'One Belt One Road' initiative; 'Chinese Universities-Postgraduate Program' is for Master's or Ph.D. level applicants of all nationalities. Age limits apply based on study level (Undergraduate/Bachelors: Under 25; Master's: Under 35; Doctoral: Under 40; General Scholar: Under 45; Senior Scholar: Under 45).
Eligible_Fields:
Science, Engineering, Agriculture, Medicine, Economics, Law
Non-degree Chinese language studies
Required_Degree: Bachelor's equivalent, Bachelor's degree, Relevant Master's degree
Experience_Years: At least 3 years of work experience preferred for some programs
Language_Certificate: IELTS 6.5, TOEFL 90, Duolingo 120, GRE General 320, GMAT 550, HSK 3 (180 points), HSK 4 (180 points)
Age: Undergraduate/Bachelors: Under 25; Master's: Under 35; Doctoral: Under 40; General Scholar: Under 45; Senior Scholar: Under 45
Special_Circumstances: South Africa: Successful scholarship applicants are required to sign a contract committing to return to South Africa upon completion of their studies.
Other_Requirements: Two letters of recommendation (for graduate and senior scholar programs, from professors or associate professors, in Chinese or English). Foreigner Physical Examination Form (for stays over 6 months). Pre-admission document (issued by target Chinese university, often required).
Scholarship_Info: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) is a prestigious award provided by the Chinese Scholarship Council (CSC) under the Chinese Ministry of Education. It is designed to attract international students to study in China, fostering educational exchange and cooperation. The scholarship supports study at a vast network of Chinese universities.

*   Copy of national ID card (e.g., CNIC/B-form for Pakistan specific)

*   Language certificate (valid HSK reports for Chinese-taught programs, or IELTS/TOEFL/Duolingo/GRE/GMAT for English-taught programs)

*   Two letters of recommendation (for graduate and senior scholar programs)

*   Any other supporting documents required by the specific university or program.

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   **Tuition Fees:** Full tuition-free education is provided for the entire duration of the scholarship.
*   **Monthly Stipend:**
    *   For Bachelor's, Master's, and One-Tier Master's programs, a monthly stipend is provided.
    *   For Doctoral level, the monthly stipend is HUF 140,000 (approximately EUR 365) for the first phase (4 semesters) and HUF 180,000 (approximately EUR 470) for the second phase (4 semesters). This stipend is provided for 12 months a year until the completion of studies.
*   **Accommodation Contribution:** Scholarship holders receive a monthly contribution of HUF 40,000 towards accommodation costs or are provided with a free dormitory place for the entire scholarship period.
*   **Medical Insurance:** Comprehensive medical insurance is included, covering all medical expenses in Hungary.
Quantity: Currently, nearly 12,000 Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders are studying. In 2025, nearly 4,500 scholarships were awarded from over 80,000 applications.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Applicants must be foreign students (non-Hungarian citizens or individuals who do not hold dual citizenship including Hungarian).
*   Applicants must be in good mental and physical health.
*   Eligibility is primarily determined by existing educational cooperation programs between Hungary and the applicant's specific Sending Partner country or territory.
*   Self-financed or fee-paying students already enrolled in a Hungarian higher education institution at the time of application are eligible to apply for the Stipendium Hungaricum program at the *same study level* only if they are recommended by their current Hungarian host universities.
*   Outstanding academic performance at the previous level of education is a prerequisite.
*   For Master's applicants (as per a specific 2026 advert), the age must be below 38 years.
*   Ukrainian citizens affected by war or natural disaster are eligible for the 'Students at Risk Subprogramme'.
Eligible_Fields:
Agricultural Sciences
Arts and Humanities
Social Science
Computer Science and Information Technology
Legal Science
Economic Science
Engineering Science
Medical and Health Science
Sport Science
Natural Science
Arts
Art Education
Political Science and Public Governance
(Note: Available study fields are highly dependent on the educational cooperation programs established between Hungary and the applicant's Sending Partner country/territory.)
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Relevant Master's degree
Language_Certificate: IELTS 6.0 (e.g., for International Business Economics), IELTS 5.0 (e.g., for BA Performance), TOEFL iBT 80 (e.g., for International Business Economics), TOEFL iBT 60 (e.g., for BA Performance), Cambridge English Exams 154 (e.g., for BA Performance)
Special_Circumstances: The 'Students at Risk Subprogramme' supports Ukrainian citizens who cannot study in war-affected areas, or students whose education or research has been halted due to war or natural disaster. It is exclusively for Ukrainian citizens affected by such circumstances. If multiple applications are submitted from a Sending Partner, it is recommended to consider gender balance. Some applicants, particularly in sports, may require a recommendation from a federation.
Other_Requirements:
*   **Motivation Letter:** A compulsory document, it must be a minimum of 1 page, typed in Times New Roman 12-point font.
*   **Reference Letters:** The necessity and specific requirements for letters of recommendation depend on the chosen school and program.
*   **Compulsory Hungarian Language Course:** All Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders who begin their studies in or after the fall semester of 2020 are required to participate in a Hungarian as a foreign language and culture course, offered free of charge by the Host Institution.
Scholarship_Info: The Stipendium Hungaricum is a prestigious scholarship program officially provided by the Hungarian Government. Launched in 2013, its primary goal is to attract top international students to pursue higher education in Hungary, fostering academic and cultural exchange.
Application_Documents:
*   Online application form
*   Motivation Letter
*   Proof of language proficiency (or a declaration if not yet available)
*   Passport or National ID (or a declaration if not yet available)
*   Final degree and transcript (to be submitted by 2025-08-01 for the 2025/2026 academic year)
*   Letter of recommendation (requirements vary by program)
*   Other program-specific documents as required by the chosen university/program.
Timeline:
Mid-November 2025 : Online application system expected to open for the 2026/2027 academic year
15 January (e.g., for the 2025/2026 academic year) : General application deadline
2025-08-01 : Final degree and transcript documents submission deadline for the 2025/2026 academic year

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition fees: All university tuition fees are fully covered.
Accommodation expenses: Free accommodation is provided.
Health insurance: Comprehensive health insurance is included, allowing students to benefit from widespread health services.
Monthly stipend: A monthly stipend is provided to cover living expenses, with amounts reaching up to 9000 TL per month for some programs.
Round-trip airfare tickets: The scholarship covers round-trip airfare, facilitating travel to and from Türkiye.
Eligible_Applicants: International students and researchers globally, excluding Turkish citizens. Eligibility is assessed based on academic success, social activities, and motivation. Age limits apply: Under 21 for undergraduate, Under 30 for master’s, Under 35 for PhD, Under 50 for Research Scholarships. Applicants must generally not be currently enrolled in a Turkish university at the same level of study they are applying for, with exceptions for certain eligible groups/programs.
Eligible_Fields: Engineering, Social Sciences, Health Sciences, Basic Sciences, Humanities, Natural Sciences, Performing Arts, Music, Fine Arts, Development Studies
Language_Certificate: TOEFL 72 (undergraduate), TOEFL 79 (graduate), IELTS 5.5 (undergraduate), Turkish Proficiency Certificate
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must be citizens of any country other than Turkey. Generally, applicants must not be currently enrolled in a Turkish university at the same level of study they are applying for, with an exception for individuals currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply for certain eligible groups/programs.
Career_Plan: A well-written motivation letter, letter of intent, or personal statement is essential to explain the applicant's goals for studying in Türkiye and how the scholarship aligns with their academic and career aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Minimum of 70% in high school for undergraduate programs. Relevant experience can strengthen an application, particularly for graduate and research programs, as suggested by the requirement for academic or professional recommendation letters. Eligibility is comprehensively assessed based on a candidate's academic success, engagement in social activities, and demonstrated motivation related to their chosen field of study. Applicants are advised to schedule and take language proficiency tests well in advance of the application deadline. Applications can be submitted in 8 languages, including Turkish, Arabic, and English. One or two letters of recommendation (academic or professional) are required. National identification card (CNIC) or Passport is a mandatory document.
Scholarship_Info: The Türkiye Scholarships (Turkiye Burslari) is a prestigious, government-funded, and highly competitive program offering international students and researchers the opportunity to pursue full-time or short-term academic programs at top universities across Türkiye. It aims to strengthen educational and cultural ties, foster future leaders, and provide a unique life experience with free higher education and comprehensive support.
Application_Documents:
- National ID (CNIC) or Passport
- Language proficiency certificates (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, or Turkish Proficiency Certificate)
- Motivation letter / Letter of intent / Personal statement
- Letters of recommendation (academic or professional)
Timeline:
January 10th : Application Opening Date (Annually)
February 20th : Application Deadline (Annually)
April to June : Interview Process (Typically conducted)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Covered Expenses include:
*   Full tuition coverage for the duration of the program.
*   Monthly stipends to cover living expenses.
*   Health insurance.
*   Visa support.
*   No application fee is required, making the application process accessible to all eligible candidates.
Eligible_Applicants: Open to foreign professionals from all over the world. Applicants must not be residing in Colombia or have started postgraduate studies in Colombia prior to applying. Candidates must not have been a previous beneficiary of ICETEX through the Beca Colombia program. Applicants must meet all academic, language, and documentation requirements as specified in the call. Eligible_Fields:

Priority Areas: scientific research, technology, and innovation.

Special_Circumstances: If selected, a change of academic program or university is not allowed. For academic programs longer than 12 months (Master's and Doctorate), the scholar must request an an extension for the second year, as scholarships are awarded on an annual term. The Government of Colombia reserves the right to terminate the scholarship and withdraw its support at any time if conditions are not met.
Other_Requirements: A recent academic letter of reference from a university professor where the applicant completed their bachelor's degree is required. Applicants must meet all academic, language, and documentation requirements as specified in the call.
Scholarship_Info: The Colombia Government Scholarship is a prestigious and highly competitive fully funded scholarship program designed for international students. It aims to promote international cooperation and academic exchange by offering exceptional candidates the opportunity to pursue postgraduate studies in Colombia.

*   Verified copies of Educational Transcripts.
*   University certificate-transcript (in English/Spanish) certifying the average grade point.

*   Document confirming the applicant has not been living in Colombia prior to applying.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully Funded Scholarships, providing 100% tuition coverage, full funding with stipends, and comprehensive coverage for travel, accommodation, and subsistence expenses.
*   Tuition fees
*   Monthly living allowances
*   Research funding
*   Travel expenses
*   Accommodation (including an Accommodation Allowance of 7,000–9,000 Baht/month, depending on location)
*   Subsistence expenses
Quantity: Approximately 50 – 80 TIPP scholarships are awarded annually to eligible developing countries.
Eligible_Applicants: International students from developing countries. Candidates must be officially nominated by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation in their respective countries (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs) or by relevant central government agencies for which the nominated candidates currently work. Civil servants must fulfill all relevant criteria prescribed in BCSR 2023. Non-civil servants must fulfill all relevant criteria prescribed by the Department of Workforce Planning and Skills Development, MoESD. Candidates must be no more than 45 years of age at the time of application. Applicants must be in good physical and mental condition.
Eligible_Fields:
Climate Change and Environmental Issues
Agriculture and Food Security
Public Health
Bio-Circular-Green Economy Model (BCG)
Specific programs mentioned for TIPP 2025: Master of Science in Occupational and Environmental Health, Master of Primary Health Care Management, Master of Science Program in Parasitology, Master of Science Program in Tropical Medicine, Master of Science Program in Science
Experience_Years: Minimum of 2-3 years of work experience with the nominating agency at the time of application.
Age: No more than 45 years of age at the time of application.
Career_Plan: Essay defining the applicant's short-term and long-term academic and career goals, demonstrating clarity and specificity in their aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Recommendation letters from at least two persons (one person per letter), typically from a university or professional context. Applicants must meet the academic standards set by the specific Thai scholarship programs and academic institutions. Candidates must meet all relevant qualification requirements and adhere to any additional academic and language standards set by the specific Thai scholarship programs. Alternatives to IELTS/TOEFL may include Duolingo English Test, PTE, evidence of strong English scores in 12th grade (>70%), or an English language proficiency certificate from a previous academic institution.
Scholarship_Info: The Thailand International Postgraduate Programme (TIPP) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship initiative provided by the Thailand Government, specifically through the Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA) in collaboration with various Thai universities and academic institutions. Introduced in 2000, TIPP serves as a foundational framework for offering postgraduate scholarships to individuals from developing partner countries. The program's core mission is to foster global partnerships, empower students with advanced skills and knowledge, and facilitate the exchange of experiences and best practices for sustainable development. Participants are also afforded the unique opportunity to immerse themselves in Thailand's rich culture and renowned hospitality. TIPP operates under the broader umbrella of Thailand International Development Cooperation (TIDC).
Application_Documents:
*   TIPP application form (available for online completion and download)
*   English test score (if required by the academic institution)
*   Recommendation letters (from at least two persons)
*   Essay defining academic and career goals
*   Other related documents as specified by TICA and the academic institution.
Timeline:

2025-01-31 : Application Deadline (example for specific programs)

Funding_Details: Includes a grant of €10,000 per academic year for the 2024-2025 and 2025-2026 academic years, along with a full tuition fee waiver. The grant is intended to cover living expenses. The scholarship duration is one academic year for 60 ECTS Master's programs and two academic years for 120 ECTS Master's programs. It cannot be combined with other scholarships from the Flemish Government or Erasmus Mundus scholarships.
Quantity: Annually: up to 45 scholarships. For 2026 intake: 30 scholarships (5 exclusively reserved for American students).
Eligible_Applicants: Open to outstanding international students from all countries. Must be applying for a Master's degree program at a participating Flemish higher education institution. Applicants must be accepted by the host institution for a degree program to receive the scholarship. The previous degree (e.g., Bachelor's) used for Master's program enrollment cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution, however, international students who have previously been enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution on credit mobility (such as Erasmus+) are still eligible. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution are not eligible to apply. The Master Mind Scholarship cannot be combined with other scholarships from the Flemish Government or Erasmus Mundus. The Flemish institution of choice must participate in the Master Mind Scholarships program. Age limit of 30 years for Master's students applies by the time of application. Applicants must demonstrate outstanding academic performance and/or potential.
Eligible_Fields:
Humanities and Social Sciences
Science
Engineering
Law and Criminology
Social Sciences
Business and Economics
Arts and Humanities
Medicine
Language_Certificate: IELTS 7.0, TOEFL 94, Certificate in Advanced English C1
Special_Circumstances: Five scholarships are exclusively reserved for American students.
Career_Plan: A letter of motivation is essential, explaining career goals and how the scholarship will help achieve them. It should precisely tie career goals to the scholarship, show how the education helps, focus on one goal, and demonstrate solutions rather than problems.
Other_Requirements: Two signed letters of recommendation from professors of the applicant's previous home university, University of Applied Sciences, School of Arts, or a recent employer. Applicants must demonstrate outstanding academic performance and/or potential.
Scholarship_Info: The Master Mind Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program provided by the Flemish Ministry of Education and Training (Government of Flanders). It is designed for outstanding international students from all countries who wish to pursue a Master's degree program in the Flanders and Brussels regions of Belgium. The scholarship supports study at various participating Flemish higher education institutions, including five universities and seven universities of applied sciences and arts.
Application_Documents:
Academic transcripts.
Two signed letters of recommendation.
A letter of motivation explaining career goals.
For specific institutions like KU Leuven, a "KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form" may be required as an annex to the application.
Timeline:
November : Application Opening Date (Generally starts)
October 15, 2025 : Application Opening Date for 2026-2027 academic year (at institutions like KU Leuven)
January 15, 2025 : KU Leuven's deadline for 2025-2026
February 1, 2025 : UAntwerp's deadline for 2025-2026
April 27, 2025 : General deadline for 2025
January 15, 2026 (23:59 CET) : KU Leuven's deadline for 2026-2027
March 15, 2026 (23:59 GMT+1) : General deadline for 2026-2027

Application Process:
1. Candidates first apply for admission to an eligible Flemish host institution for a Master's degree program.
2. The host institution preselects eligible candidates who have expressed interest in the scholarship.
3. The host institution then initiates the Master Mind scholarship application procedure by creating the candidate’s application file in the Mobility-Online tool.
4. Nominated students may then be required to complete an online Master Mind application directly with the Flemish Government.

Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship
Funding_Details:
The GOI-IES programme offers comprehensive financial support for one academic year of full-time study at the master's, postgraduate diploma, or PhD level.
Number of Awards: 60 scholarships are awarded annually.
Each scholarship includes:
*   A stipend of €10,000 for one year of full-time study.
*   A full tuition fee waiver from the host Irish higher education institution.
Covered Expenses: €10,000 stipend, Full tuition fees.
Additional Costs: Applicants must ensure they have sufficient additional funding or personal savings to cover other living costs and expenses while studying in Ireland, as the scholarship does not cover all potential expenditures beyond the stipend and tuition.
Eligible_Applicants: Applicants must be outstanding students with a domiciliary of origin outside the EU/EEA/Switzerland/United Kingdom, and be international, fee-paying students. They must have secured a conditional or final offer of admission to a full-time Level 9 (Master's or Postgraduate Diploma) or Level 10 (PhD) programme at an eligible Irish higher education institution, with the offer letter confirming international, fee-paying, full-time postgraduate student status for at least one year. Previous GOI-IES scholarship holders are not eligible. Candidates should demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement.
Eligible_Fields:
All disciplines are eligible for the scholarship.
Specific Restrictions:
*   Applicants for a research master’s scholarship must not currently hold, or have previously held, a Council Postgraduate Scholarship.
*   Applicants for a PhD degree scholarship must not currently hold, or have previously held, any Council Postgraduate Scholarship other than those which would enable them to obtain a research master’s degree.
Experience_Years: Not strictly prescribed, but prior experience is a significant assessment factor.
Special_Circumstances:
Applicants who have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship are not eligible to apply again.
Applicants for a research master’s scholarship must not currently hold, or have previously held, a Council Postgraduate Scholarship.
Applicants for a PhD degree scholarship must not currently hold, or have previously held, any Council Postgraduate Scholarship other than those which would enable them to obtain a research master’s degree.
Other_Requirements: Required: Reference letters, compelling personal statement, demonstrated strong motivation for studying in Ireland, evidence of leadership potential, clear commitment to global engagement. Prior experience is a primary assessment criterion.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious, flagship funding initiative administered by the Irish Higher Education Authority (HEA) in partnership with Irish higher education institutions. It aims to attract high-calibre international students from outside the EU/EEA/Switzerland/UK to pursue master's, postgraduate diploma, or PhD programmes in Ireland. Annually, 60 scholarships are awarded for one year of full-time study, each providing a €10,000 stipend and a full tuition fee waiver. Applicants are assessed based on academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement.
Application_Documents:
Required documents typically include:
*   Academic transcripts and certificates
*   Proof of English proficiency
*   Recommendation letters
*   Personal statements
*   Conditional or final offer of admission from an eligible Irish HEI
Applicants should also consult the GOI-IES Call Document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, and Application Help Document, all available on the official website.
Timeline:
Applications for the 2025/2026 academic year are currently open.
2025-03-05 : Application Deadline.
Scholarships are for the 2025/2026 academic year.

Funding_Details:
The Italian Government Scholarship is a fully funded opportunity, providing comprehensive financial support to its recipients.
*   **Tuition Fees:** Full coverage of tuition fees for the chosen program. However, exemptions do not apply to advanced Italian language and culture courses, for which tuition and enrollment fees may be required.
*   **Monthly Stipend:** A monthly stipend of approximately €900 is provided to cover living expenses.
*   **Insurance:** Grantees receive health, medical, and accident insurance, contracted by MAECI, for the entire duration of the grant.
*   **Additional Benefits (as mentioned by some sources):** Some sources indicate that the scholarship may also cover accommodation and airfare, though this is not universally stated across all information.
Eligible_Applicants: Open to foreign citizens living abroad and Italian citizens residing abroad (IRE). Applicants must not be residing in Italy at the time of application. Must be legally adult. Incompatible with any other scholarship or grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including regional DSU grants. Applicants must not be currently enrolled in another degree program during their study period under the scholarship. Age limits: Under 23 for Bachelor’s Degree Programs, Under 28 for Master’s Degree Programs, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs, and Italian Language and Culture Courses, Under 30 for PhD Programs. Exceptions may apply for renewals.
Eligible_Fields:
Bachelor’s Degrees
Master’s Degrees
Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs
PhD Programs
Research under Academic Supervision
Italian Language and Culture Courses
Language_Certificate: CEFR B2 (Italian or English), CEFR A2 (Italian for language courses)
Age: Under 23 for Bachelor’s, Under 28 for Master’s/AFAM/Language, Under 30 for PhD. Must be legally adult. Exceptions for renewals.
Special_Circumstances: Incompatible with any other scholarship or grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including regional DSU grants. Applicants must not be currently enrolled in another degree program during their study period under the scholarship. Applicants must not be residing in Italy at the time of application. Exceptions to age limits may apply for renewals.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must possess the appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in their chosen Italian University or Institute.
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship (MAECI Grants) is a prestigious, fully funded program by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). It aims to foster international cultural and scientific cooperation, promote the Italian language and higher education system, and support Italy’s economic system worldwide, enabling foreign citizens and Italian citizens residing abroad (IRE) to pursue higher education and research in Italy.
Application_Documents:
*   **Admission Letter:** An admission letter from an Italian university is generally required, and it is mandatory for PhD program applicants.
*   **Language Proficiency Certificate:** Official certificate demonstrating the required Italian or English language proficiency (if applicable).
*   **Personal Statement:** A personal statement, typically with a maximum of 1000 words, outlining motivation and academic goals.
*   **Score Statement:** Academic transcripts or score statements.

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition Fees: Full coverage.
Living Allowance: Approximately CNY 1,700 per month, totaling ¥20,000 annually, specifically for Master's and PhD students.
Insurance: Comprehensive insurance coverage worth CNY 800 per year.
One-Time Allowance for New Students: A grant of CNY 800 for new scholarship recipients.
Other Expenses: Financial assistance to cover materials, accommodation, and other study-related expenses.
Covered Expenses include: Tuition fees, Living allowance, Insurance, One-time allowance for new students, Materials, Accommodation, Other study-related expenses.
Eligible_Applicants: Applicants must be international students (non-Chinese citizens), in good mental and physical health. The scholarship is open to both prospective and current international students pursuing undergraduate, master's, or Ph.D. programs at eligible universities in Tianjin. Applicants must be self-funded international students applying for or already enrolled at eligible universities in Tianjin. Previous recipients of the Tianjin Government Scholarship are not eligible to re-apply.
Eligible_Fields: Generally open to various undergraduate, master's, and doctoral programs. Specifically mentioned: Chemical Engineering (Master's at Tianjin University).
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Relevant Master's degree, PhD
Experience_Years: At least three years of work experience for applicants with a bachelor's degree or higher (for specific programs/universities).
Special_Circumstances: Previous recipients of the Tianjin Government Scholarship are not eligible to re-apply.
Other_Requirements:
Passports must have a validity period of six months or more.
Physical examination required; applicants with residence permits may provide a physical examination record of the year or a health certificate from their university.
Two letters of recommendation are required for Master's and Doctoral applicants.
A comprehensive personal statement (including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, and personal strengths) written in Chinese or English is required. It should be no less than 800 words for Master's/Doctoral applicants and no less than 300 words for Bachelor's applicants.
Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship (TGS) is a prestigious award established by the Tianjin Municipal Government in China. Its primary objective is to sponsor talented international students for undergraduate and postgraduate studies within Tianjin. The scholarship aims to provide an outstanding opportunity for recipients to receive an internationally respected education and immerse themselves in the vibrant atmosphere of Tianjin, one of China’s biggest and most rapidly growing cities.
Application_Documents:
Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form (to be registered at the online application system).
Application Form for Foreigners Wishing to Study at Tianjin University (for TJU applicants).
Personal Statement/Study Plan.
Admission Letter (if applicable).
Application Form for Visa to China (JW202 or JW201).
Physical Examination Report/Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
Passports.
Original No Crime Certificate.
Chinese or English Proficiency Certificate (HSK, TOEFL, IELTS).
Study Experience Resume.
Two letters of recommendation (for Master's and Doctoral applicants).
